data.description:
Blast the polygon alien horde and claim your place in the Hall of Heroes! Cosmic Survivor is an intense, survival shoot 'em up with roguelite elements, where your skill is on trial and the horde is always waiting.

Sit in comfort and play with a single controller as the game world surrounds you. Features a short game loop with rising intensity. Learn the best survival strategy or upgrade your ship over time to climb the global leaderboard.

changelog.change_log:
Gameplay

Mines can now be activated with weapon fire

Mines can now be pushed with ship contact

Boss Mobs now have a 15% chance of not spawning anything on death



Visual

Boss Mob death explosion more unique

Visual flair when Rhino Rush is available

New Mine explosion

Removed stutter with Rank and Evolution screen messages



BugFix

Metal mobs push other mobs in direction of movement

Ship in Trailer not firing when trigger held before death
Pickups more abundant at start of game.

v1.1
Updated visuals and new Evolution options.

Evolution options for each ship

On-Screen notifications for Evolution and Rank progress.

Visual updates to Asteroids, Enemies, most special effects.

Tech points no longer spawn if you have reached the Max useable (1560).

New audio track when ship evolved.

Enemies merge more frequently.

Smaller but more numerous asteroids.
HotFix: Tech Points should be more reliable

Bugfix: Asteroids near top/bottom screen sometimes missing collision.
Bugfix: Potential game crash when interrupting tutorial.
Bugfix: Tech Points dupe quitting the game before \"Game Over\"
Leaderboard character limit extended from 18 to 20.
Visual effect added after Rhino Rush to help visibility.
Potential loss of Tech Points after a code update fixed for future updates. Each existing player has had their Tech Points set to double their Viper high score to compensate.
Tutorial extended to show Pick Ups and evolution of charged shot.

Added ship tutorial
Tech points awarded more frequently
Extended Hall of Fame character limit

Beefier explosions.
Lowest difficulty starts off slower.
